recoveryPlanChecks.name: Recovery Plan Documentation and Version Control
recoveryPlanChecks.description: Recovery plans should be comprehensively documented with proper version control and change management

testResults.details: 93.3% documentation coverage with ISO 22301 alignment and board approval

testResults.test: Version control and change management validation
testResults.details: Azure DevOps integration with GitFlow branching and multi-level approval workflows

testResults.test: Plan structure and content quality evaluation
testResults.details: Consistent structure across all plans with comprehensive content coverage

recoveryPlanChecks.remediation: Recovery plan documentation comprehensively implemented with robust version control and change management

recoveryPlanChecks.name: RTO/RPO Alignment Validation
recoveryPlanChecks.description: Recovery plans should demonstrate clear alignment with defined RTO and RPO objectives

testResults.test: RTO/RPO alignment coverage and accuracy assessment
testResults.details: 96.7% alignment accuracy with 93.3% coverage across recovery plans
Recovery time estimates within tolerance ranges for all service categories
Automated alignment checking with dashboards and deviation alerting

recoveryPlanChecks.remediation: RTO/RPO alignment comprehensively validated with strong monitoring and automated deviation detection

recoveryPlanChecks.name: Incomplete Stakeholder Training and Awareness
recoveryPlanChecks.description: Recovery plan stakeholders lack comprehensive training and awareness of their roles and responsibilities

testResults.test: Stakeholder training coverage and currency assessment
testResults.details: 56.7% training coverage with annual frequency vs recommended quarterly training
Generic training content with limited hands-on exercises and scenario-based learning
No knowledge retention testing or competency validation beyond self-assessment

recoveryPlanChecks.remediation: HIGH PRIORITY: 1) Achieve 100% stakeholder training coverage with quarterly sessions and role-specific content, 2) Implement comprehensive hands-on simulation exercises with scenario-based training, 3) Develop competency validation and knowledge retention testing for all recovery roles, 4) Establish cross-functional training to improve coordination and communication, 5) Create training effectiveness metrics with performance measurement and continuous improvement, 6) Deploy training management system with automated tracking and certification management

recoveryPlanChecks.name: Limited Recovery Automation and Orchestration
recoveryPlanChecks.description: Recovery plans lack comprehensive automation and orchestration capabilities to meet recovery objectives

testResults.details: 42.9% automation coverage with 89 manual procedures requiring human intervention
Limited orchestration platform with manual cross-service coordination

testResults.test: Recovery monitoring and alerting automation check
testResults.details: Basic monitoring with manual exception handling and recovery validation

recoveryPlanChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Increase recovery automation coverage to 80% with comprehensive orchestration platform implementation, 2) Deploy Infrastructure as Code for automated infrastructure recovery and reconfiguration, 3) Implement application recovery automation with dependency resolution and health check validation, 4) Establish automated data recovery workflows with integrity validation and rollback capabilities, 5) Create comprehensive recovery monitoring with automated status reporting and exception handling, 6) Develop automated testing and validation frameworks for recovery procedure verification

recoveryPlanChecks.name: Inadequate Cross-Functional Coordination
recoveryPlanChecks.description: Recovery plans lack comprehensive cross-functional coordination and communication procedures

testResults.details: No recovery command center with unclear decision-making hierarchy and basic communication protocols
Basic internal templates with limited external communication planning and backup methods
No cross-functional exercises or coordination effectiveness measurement

recoveryPlanChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Establish recovery command center with clear decision-making hierarchy and communication protocols, 2) Develop comprehensive communication plans for internal, external, customer, and regulatory stakeholders, 3) Define clear roles, responsibilities, and authority levels for all cross-functional recovery activities, 4) Implement regular cross-functional coordination exercises with effectiveness measurement, 5) Create backup communication channels and methods for all stakeholder groups, 6) Establish interdepartmental handoff procedures with testing and validation protocols

recoveryPlanChecks.name: Missing Plan Currency and Maintenance
recoveryPlanChecks.description: Recovery plans lack systematic currency maintenance and regular updates to reflect changing business and technical environments

testResults.test: Plan maintenance process and frequency assessment
testResults.details: Annual maintenance only vs recommended quarterly with unclear ownership and triggers

testResults.test: Environmental change tracking and integration evaluation
testResults.details: Manual change tracking with limited integration of infrastructure, application, and business changes

testResults.test: Plan currency metrics and validation effectiveness
testResults.details: No systematic currency metrics or plan effectiveness indicators

recoveryPlanChecks.remediation: HIGH PRIORITY: 1) Implement quarterly plan maintenance schedule with defined triggers and clear ownership assignments, 2) Establish automated change tracking integration with infrastructure, application, and business process changes, 3) Develop systematic plan validation and testing procedures with stakeholder feedback integration, 4) Create plan currency metrics and effectiveness indicators with automated monitoring, 5) Implement automated plan update notifications and impact assessment workflows, 6) Establish continuous plan optimization process with regular effectiveness reviews and improvement recommendations
